Summary:
**Summary of All Core Devs Meeting 125**

The primary focus area for this meeting was **Protocol decisions and EIP discussions**, with a significant emphasis on Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 4844, which aims to increase the block gas limit by introducing a new data structure called "Proto-Danksharding". The proposal has been met with both enthusiasm and skepticism from core developers. After an in-depth discussion, it was decided that EIP-4844 will be implemented as part of Ethereum's upcoming Shanghai hardfork (version 1.2), scheduled for April 2023.

**Technical issues, bugs, and proposed solutions** were also discussed at length during the meeting. A critical bug affecting the execution engine in Geth client version 1.10 was identified and a patch has been submitted to fix it. Additionally, there is an ongoing effort to resolve performance issues with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) on low-end hardware.

In terms of **development milestones and testing updates**, the meeting highlighted progress towards implementing EIP-4844 in Geth client version 1.11. The development team has also made significant strides in improving test coverage, aiming for a minimum threshold of 90% by Q2 2023.

**Client implementation progress** was another key area discussed during the meeting. Parity and Besu clients are both working towards implementing EIP-4844, with expected completion timelines aligned with Geth's version 1.11 release schedule. The team is also exploring ways to improve client interoperability through standardized APIs.

Lastly, **action items and upcoming deadlines** were outlined for core developers. Key tasks include finalizing the implementation of EIP-4844 in all major clients by Q2 2023 and conducting thorough testing before the Shanghai hardfork deployment.
